thread.title: Watch Star Wars' Daisy Ridley Heroically Endure the World's Most Annoying Instagram Prank
thread.title_full: Watch Star Wars' Daisy Ridley Heroically Endure the World's Most Annoying Instagram Prank

title: Watch Star Wars' Daisy Ridley Heroically Endure the World's Most Annoying Instagram Prank

organizations.name: daisy ridley heroically endure the world

text:
Watch Star Wars' Daisy Ridley Heroically Endure the World's Most Annoying Instagram Prank By This is what you get when your full-time job is Star Wars, it seems. EDITORâ€™S PICK So Is Star Wars' Rogue One Any Good or What? 
Daisy Ridley just wants to be left alone. The Star Wars actor undoubtedly has to field all kinds of questions every day about plot details for The Last Jedi and beyond. Ridley's character, Rey, is one of the most mysterious aspects of the new trilogy; she's for sure "with the Force" and her parents are all but nailed-on to be a big reveal in this next movie (or the one after that). 
It's only understandable, then, that someone with access to Ridley might try to wheedle some info. Here's Beauty and the Beast star Josh Gad, currently filming Murder on the Orient Express with Ridley, trying to extract what he can: Loading 
A week later, he goes again, this time with some sneakier tactics. Loading View on Instagram 
Finally, Gad goes all-out, ambushing poor Daisy Ridley with a cavalcade of Star Wars fans' burning questions, except Chris Pratt, who seems to have a completely different agenda. These behind-the-scenes prank bits always toe the line between cutesy and annoying, especially since we, and Ridley, are still many months away from The Last Jedi 's release. Her wry smile at the end means it's hard for any of this to be too grating, but the whole thing sure feels like one of those not-so-subtle "look how many famous friends I have" insta-brags. Loading 
Anyway, for those looking for some big answers, there you have it: Penelope Cruz is a Star Wars fan. Watch now: How Amy Schumer got into bed with Star Wars
